result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Ignacio P Velazquez was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Ignacio P Velazquez was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:

Consecutive to: Concurrent with Portage County Case No. 08CF399 but Consecutive to the  Waushara County Case No. 11CF169.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay fine of $2,400 plus costs during period of sentence. 
Pay all supervision fees.
25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not associate with anyone possessing or consuming alcohol.
Comply with other counseling as recommended by the agent and COMPAS assessment, including cognitive behavior counseling and potentially social adjustment.
AODA & comply with requirements, comply with safety plan.

records.addlTxt: of Conviction and Order - ERP /s/ TTF 08/22/17
from defendant dated 01/26/17 in re:  Reminder Notice received

Prosecuting Atty Cass W Cousins appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Ignacio P Velazquez appeared by phone. 
(Clerk calls Defendant from prison)

1:49 PM Court calls case.
Court states appearances. 

Court reviews the file with regards to interpreter.
Atty Cousins states that Defendant did not need an interpreter at the sentencing.

Atty Drengler is in the courtroom but is not here for this case. Atty Drengler stated that Defendant didn't need an interpreter.

Defendant states he does not need an interpreter.  Defendant requests Court to talk slow because it is loud where the Defendant is.

Defendant can write English.
Defendant wrote the letters that have been sent to the Court but had someone help him, his teacher helped make paragraphs.

Defendant inquired as to earned release and challenge incarceration programs.

Court reviews the transcript, reads part of the transcript for the record.

1:58 PM Court questions Defendant. Defendant is serving his last sentence now, started it in November of last year.  Defendant will be released in November 2017.

Defendant is moving the Court for a sentence modification. Defendant is representing himself.

2:02 PM Atty Cousins addresses the Court. Defendant was not eligible for earned release program due to prior participation in the program. Atty Cousins does not have a position and will defer to the Court.

Court addresses the parties.
Court did not do the sentencing, Judge Fleishauer did the sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Court makes Defendant eligible for earned release program but not until after Defendant has served 17 months. 
JOC is to be amended and to be sent to institution.

Defendant Ignacio P Velazquez in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Defendant Ignacio P Velazquez in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

11:12 AM Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

Matter is set for a sentencing hearing at this time.
Both parties have received a copy of the PSI.
Atty Drengler has no factual corrections but points out a typograhical error.
Court states the error is very significant.

Atty Cousins addresses the Court, agent is not present, has not spoken to the agent.
Atty Drengler is willing to proceed with the understanding.

Court notes the error.

Atty Cousins addresses the Court prior to sentencing, gives sentencing recommendations for Count 1 and Count 3.
BAC: .329

Court questions Atty Cousins for clarifications.

Atty Drengler addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court questions Atty Drengler for clarifications.

Parties continue discussions regarding concurrent and consecutive sentencings.

Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court addresses the parties.
Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
Determinate Prison Sentence for 5 Years
Initial Confinement for 2 Years
Extended Supervision for 3 Years
Concurrent to the 2008 offense
Consecutive to the 2012 offense
Credit for 1 Month and 2 Days 
Conditions of Extended Supervision:
Eligible for boot camp but not eligible for earned release
Pay a $2,400 fine plus costs during period of sentence
Pay blood draw fee of $26.45
Drivers License Revoked for 36 Months
IID for 36 Months
AODA and comply with requirements, comply with safety plan  - BAC: .329
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment
Obtain and Maintain full time employment
Comply with other counseling as recommended by the agent and COMPAS assessment, including cognitive behavior counseling and potentially social adjustment
Do not associate with anyone possessing or consuming alcohol
Pay all supervision fees

Count 3:
Jail sentence for 30 days, concurrent to other sentences being served
Pay court costs


Court did not order DNA Surcharge on either count.

Appeal rights are addressed.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing at 06-16-2015 11:00 am

Defendant Ignacio P Velazquez in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Defendant Ignacio P Velazquez in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
11:02 a.m. case is called and appearances stated on the record.
This is a plea agreement

Prosecutor states plea agreement and requests a PSI be ordered.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
Defendant agrees this is 6th offense.

Defendant enters a plea of:  Ct. 1 - No Contest
Ct 3. - No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.  Defendant is able to read and understand English and his attorney had no problems with communicating with him.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.  Cannot vote until civil rights are restored and cannot possess any firearm or weapon.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently made.
Defendant verifies his signature 
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant Guilty of 6th offense and OAR in Ct. 3 - 1st offense, Ct. 2 - dismissed outright.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

BY THE COURT:
Court Orders a PSI

Court asks the defendant to sign a document re: voting rights 

PSI must be completed by 6-9-2015 and copies forwarded to counsel

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Plea hearing at 04-13-2015 11:00 am

Defendant Ignacio P Velazquez in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Defendant Ignacio P Velazquez in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

10:09 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.
Pre-Trial to be Held Today.
Arraignment on March 30, 2015 at 10:00 am.

3:19 p.m.  Defendant Ignacio P Velazquez in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Defendant Ignacio P Velazquez in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Bond Continued  Arraignment scheduled for March 30, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 9, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Ignacio P Velazquez appeared by video. Attorney Ryan Drengler in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

(Video equipment error.  Court reconnects at this time.) 
Court informs the defendant of charges/maximum penalties again. 
Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.
Defendant makes statements to the Court re: signing revocation papers. 
Atty Drengler informs his client he will discuss with him.  

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 9, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Atty Drengler

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not operate a vehicle without a valid driver's license.
If he posts bond, Participate in the Portage County Pre-Trial Supervision Program and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment, and programming.

1:24 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

ADA Cass Cousins appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Cousins states facts for anticipated charges of OWI 6th offense. 
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

State requests a $20,000 cash bond with conditions as stated.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for: 2/23/2015  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 2
